intro: Fagopyrum lineare, commonly known as narrowleaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Asia and North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring simple, alternate leaves that are lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for garden cultivation. Its botanical features make it an attractive and low-maintenance addition to native plant gardens.
